defs: an egg of the house-fly.
(pl.) two fists.
quantity that can be held in both the hands and fingers pressing (the thing) tightly.
(pl.) two handles (of the same object such as sword, dagger, etc.).
a sword that can be used by both the hands; a sword with two grips.
to hold, seize with both the hands.
to open or remove the lid, cover; to disclose;
any of a genus (Musca) of disease-carrying muscid flies found in and around houses, and feeding on garbage, manure, and food; a house-fly.
to decorate; to beautify.
a rope made of two intertwisted strands of fibre, thin wires, leather strips, etc.
(pl.) two parts (of a whole).
an informal unit of linear measure (of depth or height) equal to the height of two men.
the tree Madhuca indica ( = Bassia latifolia) of Sapotaceae family; Indian butter tree.
the tree Madhuca longifolia ( = Bassia longifolia) of the same family; wild sapota.
the act of chewing a second time the once taken food regurgitated from the stomach.
the fixing of the mind on an subject; serious thought; contemplation; reflection.

ಇಪ್ಪೆಹಾಕು ippehāku to chew slowly a second time a mouthful of previously swallowed food regurgitated from the first two chambers of the stomach; 2. to recall and think over something; to ruminate; to ponder; to chew the cud; ರೆಪ್ಪೆ ಹಂದಿದರೆ ಇಪ್ಪೆ ಹಾಕುವುದು ಬಿಟ್ಟೀತೆ reppe handidare ippe hākuvudu biṭṭīte (prov.) a natural process cannot be stopped by winking at it.
the state or fact of being.

a variety in paddy that gives the smell of the flower of Indian butter tree (Madhuca indica).
the stickiness of the oil extracted from the seeds of Indian butter tree.

oil extracted from the seeds of Indian butter tree (Madhuca indica).
the cake got from the seeds of Indian butter tree (Madhuca indica) after the oil is extracted.
(pl.) the two periods of the day; day and night.

(pl.) the two segments or pieces of a fruit, vegetable, etc. 2) the two split parts of any party, school of thought; two factions.
to tear into two pieces.

as per the science of erotics, a woman belonging to a particular class (which is based on the physical characteristics of women).

a rich man; a man with fairly good resources.
one who betrays both the rival sides crossing from one side to the other.
the quality of such a person; treachery; double cross.
a person or animal with the sexual organs of both the male and the female; a hermaphrodite.
a plant having stamens and pistils in the same flower; a hermaphrodite.
a stupid person.
the offspring produced by crossing two individuals of unlike genetic constitution esp. the offspring of two animals or plants of different races, varieties, species, etc.; hybrid.
a wild animal akin to black leopard.
any situation in which one must choose between two unpleasant alternatives.
the game plan of a double-cross person.
a community whose trade is basically trading.

(one's mind) to face a dilemma; to be at cross road; to face a dilemma.

the state of indecision; dilemma.

the condensation formed, usu. during the night, on lawns, cars, etc. as a result of relatively warm air contacting a cool surface; dew.

the plant Callicarpa tomentosa ( = C. lantana) of Verbenaceae family.

ಇಬ್ಬರ ಜಗಳ ಮೂರನೆಯವನಿಗೆ ಲಾಭ ibbara jagaḷa mūraneyavanige lābha (prov.) two dogs strive for a bone and the third runs away with it; ಇಬ್ಬರ ನ್ಯಾಯ ಮೂರನೆಯವನಿಗೆ ಆಯ ibbara nyāya mūraneyavanige āya (prov.) = ಇಬ್ಬರ ಜಗಳ ಮೂರನೆಯವನಿಗೆ ಲಾಭ; ಇಬ್ಬರಿದ್ದರೆ ಏಕಾಂತ, ಮೂವರಿದ್ದರೆ ಲೋಕಾಂತ ibbariddare ēkānta, mūvariddare lōkānta (prov.) two is for keeping a secret while third broadcasts it; it is no secret what is known to three.

a sword with blades on both the sides; a double-edged sword.

one of the Dravidian languages that is closer to Tamil.

of Hebrew or the Hebrew.

a huge, thick-skinned, almost hairless mammal, the largest of extant four-footed animals, which can be domesticated, with a long, flexible snout (called 'trunk') and, usually, two ivory tusks growing out of the upper jaw; Indian elephant; Elephas maximus (order: Proboscidea).
the way an elephant walks.
the elephant-gait like walking; a slow, majestic and sublime gait.

a herd of elephants.

a female elephant.
elephantine - a) of an elephant or elephants; b) like an elephant in size or gait; huge; heavy; slow.
having wealth; wealthy; opulent; rich.

a herd of elephants.
a wealthy man.

ಇರಗೊಡಿಸು iragoḍsu to allow to be; 2. to allow to settle (at one place); ಇರಗೊಡು iragoḍu to allow to be; 2. to allow to settle (at one place); ಇರಮಾಡು iramāḍu to cause to be; 2. to cause to be settled (at one place); ಇರಸಲ್ಲ irasalla not fit to be; not fit to be settled (at one place); ಇರಹವಂ irahavam he who is (as so and so); 2. he who is settled (at some place); ಇರುವವ iruvava he who is (as so and so); 2. a person or nation with relatively much wealth or rich resources; a have; ಇದ್ದಕ್ಕಿದ್ದಂತೆ iddakkiddante as it is; without any change; 2. suddenly; at once; 3. without preparation; abruptly; ಇದ್ದಕ್ಕಿದ್ದ ಹಾಗೆ iddakkidda hāge = ಇದ್ದಕ್ಕಿದ್ದಂತೆ; ಇದ್ದರೆ iddare if (it is) so; 2. if available; ಇದೆಲ್ಲಾ/ಇವೆಲ್ಲಾ ಇದ್ದದ್ದೇ idellalā/ivellā iddaddē (saying) 'that bad things happen, and there is nothing one can do to prevent them, so it is not worth becoming upset about them'; ಇದ್ದದ್ದನ್ನು ಇದ್ದ ಹಾಗೆ ಹೇಳಿದರೆ ಸಿದ್ದಪ್ಪನಿಗೆ ಸಿಡಿಲು ಬಡೀತು iddaddannu idda hāge hēḷidare siddappanige siḍilu baḍītu (prov.) hard fact is difficult to digest; ಇದ್ದದ್ದು ಇದ್ದ ಹಾಗೆ ಹೇಳಿದರೆ ಎದ್ದುಬಂದು ಎದಗೆ ಒದೆ iddaddu idda hāge hēḷidare eddubandu edege ode (prov.) a truth-teller finds the door closed against him; ಇದ್ದದ್ದು ಹೇಳಿದರೆ ಹದ್ದಿನಂತೆ ಮೋರೆಯಾಗು iddaddu hēḷidare haddinahāge mōreyāgu (prov.) = ಇದ್ದದ್ದು ಇದ್ದ ಹಾಗೆ ಹೇಳಿದರೆ ಎದ್ದುಬಂದು ಎದಗೆ ಒದೆ; ಇದ್ದದ್ದು ಹೋಯಿತು ಮದ್ದಿನ ಗುಣ iddaddu hōyitu maddina guṇa (prov.) striving to make (something) better, we oft mar what is well; ಇದ್ದಲ್ಲಿ ಗೌಡ, ಹೋದಲ್ಲಿ ಕಿವುಡ idalli gauḍa, hōdalli kivuda (prov.) every dog is a lion at home; ಇದ್ದವರು ಮೂವರಲ್ಲಿ ಕದ್ದವರು ಯಾರು? iddavaru mūvaralli kaddavaru yāru (prov.) all are good maids, but where come the bad wives; ಇದ್ದಮಕ್ಕಳಿಗೇ ಕೂಳಿಲ್ಲ, ಮತ್ತೊಂದು ಕೊಡೋ ಶಿವರಾಯ iddamakkaḷigē kūḷilla, mattondu koḍō śivarāya (prov.) pray for more difficulties; ಇದ್ದಾಗ ಹಿರಿ ಹಬ್ಬ, ಇಲ್ಲದಾಗ ಕಿರಿ ಹಬ್ಬ iddāga hiri habba, illadāga kiri habba (prov.) = ಇದ್ದಾಗ ಹಿರಿಯಣ್ಣ, ಇಲ್ಲದಾಗ ತಿರಿಯಣ್ಣ; ಇದ್ದಾಗ ಹಿರಿಯಣ್ಣ, ಇಲ್ಲದಾಗ ತಿರಿಯಣ್ಣ iddāga hiriyaṇṇa, illadāga kiryaṇṇa (prov.) prudent is he not who saves not for tomorrow; ಇದ್ದಾಗ ನವಾಬ ಸಾಹೇಬ, ಇಲ್ಲದಾಗ ಫಕೀರಸಾಹೇಬ iddāga navāba sāhēba, illadāga phakīra sāhēba (prov.) = ಇದ್ದಾಗ ಹಿರಿಯಣ್ಣ, ಇಲ್ಲದಾಗ ತಿರಿಯಣ್ಣ; ಇದ್ದಿದ್ದೊಂದಿಷ್ಟು ಇಲಿ ಕಚ್ಚಿಕೊಂಡು ಹೋಯಿತು iddiddondiṣṭu ili kaccikoṇḍu hōyitu (prov.) misfortune led to lose whatever little one had; ಇದ್ದವನು ಮಾಡಿದರೆ ವ್ಯವಹಾರ, ಇಲ್ಲದವನು ಮಾಡಿದರೆ ವ್ಯಭಿಚಾರ iddavanu māḍidare vyavahāra, illadavanu māḍidare vyabhicāra (prov.) money covers the misdeeds; ಇರಲಾರದೆ ಇರುವೆ ಬಿಟ್ಟುಕೊಂಡ iralārade iruve biṭṭukoṇḍa (prov.) to invite trouble deliberately or mischievously; ಇರುವವಳು ಇಟ್ಟುಕೊಂಡರೆ, ಇಲ್ಲದವಳಿಗೆ ಮುಲುಕಾಟ iruvavaḷu iṭṭukoṇḍare illadavaḷige mulukāṭa (prov.) envy burns from within; ಇಲ್ಲದವರಿಗೆ ಒಂದು ಚಿಂತೆ ಇದ್ದವರಿಗೆ ನೂರಾರು ಚಿಂತೆ illadavarige ondu cinte, iddavarige nūrāru cinte (prov.) poor worries only about his not having money, while rich has hundred worries about the money he has.
